title: Hilary Duff struggles with son's homework after leaving school in grade 3
text:
Poor Hilary Duff. The child star left school in third grade to become a massive actress and turns out that’s not coming in handy as she tried to help her kid with homework this week.

The Younger actress, 32, left ‘real’ school in order to become a star on Lizzie McGuire way back as a pre-teen.

Now she’s lamented her home-schooling days on set and while travelling, as she struggled to aid young son, Luca, seven, in his maths.

To be fair, we didn’t leave school at 13 and would still more than likely have a hard time picking up the algebra after all these years.

Posing alongside her kid – she also shares baby Banks, who will turn one later this month, with partner Matthew Koma – Hilary pulled a face as they attempted to hit the books.

Hilary is set to reprise her role at Lizzie (Picture: Getty Images North America)

‘This guy with his spirit and kindness💔Homework is already no joke in 2nd grade,’ Hilary wrote.

‘I stopped going to “real” school in 3rd grade so I’m actually doomed…

‘I am left scratching my head all the time looking at his homework and I’m terrified for next year!’

She added: ‘Although Singapore math is the sh*t….also learned a lot about tick birds this week.’

Hey, the more you know.

The actress became a star from the age of 10 when she scored a big break playing Wendy the witch in 1998’s Casper Meets Wendy.

With partner Matthew Koma (Picture: FilmMagic)

From there she became a household name in her Disney Channel Show Lizzie McGuire, which ran from 2001 to 2004.

The hit teen show is soon to be rebooted on Disney+. And what’s more, lead star Hilary is hinting former leading man Adam Lamberg might join her on the revival.

‘I really hope he’s going to be involved,’ an excited Hilary enthused in a new interview.

‘We’ve been planning out the season and coming up with what everything looks like, and it’s so important for him to be there for part of it.’

Hilary famously played titular character Elizabeth, while Adam played David ‘Gordo’ Gordon.

Lizzie McGuire ended back in 2004 when Hilary was 16 years old and will pick things up around the same as age as what Lizzie will be now, in her early 30s.

‘Finally being in my 30s, it felt like a good time to revisit her,’ said Hilary.

‘It’s a complicated stage. That’s what people loved about Lizzie so much — that phase of becoming a teenager. It’s such a complicated but fun part of time to navigate. She was everyone’s best friend.

‘She was faced with every challenge that was relatable. Now, I think stepping into the role as a 30-year-old trying to navigate life is equally interesting. Or more specifically, waking up on your 30th birthday and thinking, this isn’t how I planned this to look, what do I do now? That’s an interesting story to me.’
